intro: Linnaeopsis heckmanniana subsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slender linnaeopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Native to tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
